description: Retrieves a list of configuration items that have tags as specified by the key-value pairs, name and value, passed to the optional parameter filters. There are three valid tag filter names: Also, all configuration items associated with your user that have tags can be listed if you call DescribeTags as is without passing any parameters.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: You can filter the list using a key-value format. You can separate these items by using logical operators. Allowed filters include tagKey, tagValue, and configurationId. (dict) --- The tag filter. Valid names are: tagKey, tagValue, configurationId. A name of the tag filter. Values for the tag filter. (string) ---

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: A name of the tag filter.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: Depending on the input, this is a list of configuration items tagged with a specific tag, or a list of tags for a specific configuration item.

nested_items.name: configurationType
nested_items.description: A type of IT asset to tag.

nested_items.name: configurationId
nested_items.description: The configuration ID for the item to tag. You can specify a list of keys and values.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: A type of tag on which to filter. For example, serverType.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: A value on which to filter. For example key = serverType and value = web server.

nested_items.name: timeOfCreation
nested_items.description: The time the configuration tag was created in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The call returns a token. Use this token to get the next set of results.
